task_summary: The robot reaches towards a towel, starting from an upright idle pose and sequentially approaching, aligning, and verifying arrival at the towel. The plan strictly follows the observable contact sheet frames.

task_long_description.overview: This episode tasks a bimanual robot arm system to reach a towel laid out horizontally on a workspace. The sequence involves perceiving the towel's location, approaching it via controlled movement, and verifying proximity. No grasp is involved, the robot ends with its end-effector close to or above the towel, as confirmed by the final frame. The robot acts in a known environment with no visible obstacles, following a perception and approach routine typical for object-reaching tasks.
preconditions: Towel is placed flat and visible on the workspace.
Robot starts in a neutral ready pose.
stepwise_plan: Check if towel is visible; if not, initiate scan.
Move end-effector above or near the towel using segmented increments.
Upon arrival, confirm final position relative to towel.
success_criteria: Robot's end-effector reliably arrives at the towel's location.
Final pose is stable and trackable.
failure_and_recovery: Failure: Perception misses towel due to occlusion; Recovery: Retry scan procedure up to 3 attempts.
Failure: Motion blocked; Recovery: Abort or replan route.
Failure: Position error outside tolerance; Recovery: Re-detect and approach again.
task_long_description.termination: Episode terminates when robot is confirmed at the target towel location or all retries fail.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if towel is visible to robot sensors.
Scans for the towel in a line pattern up to 3 times, moderate timeout.
Runs object detection on the towel.
Moves the end-effector to the towel.
Checks if the end-effector is now at the towel.

recovery_strategy: Retry scan up to 3 times if not visible
Abort on repeated MoveTo or detection failures
assumptions: Instruction says 'grasp', but no grasp motion is supported by the episode frames; only reach/approach is used.
Towel is always assumed as stationary and flat per all observed frames.
No grasp nor manipulation beyond reaching is performed; this is strictly mapped to visual sequence.
No external disturbances visible; robot acts with standard parameters.

expected_success_criteria: End-effector is at or above target towel at the end.
